summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney 'C.' and defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz, with Roy Black copied, discussing the filing of a reply brief in the case 'Jane Does v. United States' and sharing personal notes about Broadway shows. The AUSA attaches Brad Edwards's reply brief and related correspondence, indicating legal disputes over the confidentiality of an agreement involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Attorney communicating with an Assistant U.S. Attorney about the 'Jane Does v. United States' case and discussing personal plans to see a Broadway show.

persons.name: C. (USAFLS)
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney corresponding with defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz, sharing the reply brief filed by Brad Edwards and discussing the case 'Jane Does v. United States'.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email chain discussing the reply brief in 'Jane Does v. United States'.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney who filed a reply brief and motion to unseal an agreement in the case 'Jane Does v. United States', as referenced by the AUSA.

persons.name: Mr. Lee
persons.context: Mentioned as potentially not having received correspondence from Brad Edwards regarding the motion to unseal.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the client of Jay Lefkowitz and as a party to a confidential agreement that is the subject of Brad Edwards's motion to unseal.

persons.name: Patti Lupone
persons.context: Broadway actress mentioned in a personal discussion about seeing the show 'Gypsy'.

connections.description: Defense attorney and Assistant U.S. Attorney corresponding about a legal case and sharing personal anecdotes.
Both are defense attorneys copied on the same email regarding the 'Jane Does v. United States' case.
Lefkowitz mentions 'my client' in the context of plaintiffs suing, referring to Jeffrey Epstein.
Edwards is an attorney suing Epstein and filing motions related to unsealing an agreement involving Epstein.
The AUSA is reviewing and forwarding Edwards's legal filings in the case against the United States.

events.title: Brad Edwards Files Letter
events.description: Brad Edwards files a letter regarding a motion to unseal an agreement, which the AUSA had not seen prior to its filing.

events.title: Reply Brief Filed in Jane Does v. United States
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney 'C.' forwards the reply brief filed by Brad Edwards in the case 'Jane Does v. United States' to defense attorneys Jay Lefkowitz and Roy Black.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The document is an email chain showing informal, personal communication between a federal prosecutor and a defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein amidst ongoing litigation.
It references a legal dispute over the confidentiality of an agreement involving Jeffrey Epstein, with plaintiff's attorney Brad Edwards seeking to unseal it.

The Assistant U.S. Attorney indicates the government's position was that issues regarding the Epstein agreement should be litigated in suits filed by Edwards against Epstein, not in the lawsuit against the United States.
The correspondence includes a standard Kirkland & Ellis confidentiality footer, indicating Lefkowitz's affiliation with that firm.
The personal discussion about Broadway shows ('Gypsy', 'In the Heights', 'Sweeney Todd') occurs alongside substantive legal discussion about a high-profile case.
